plantingReason: Cool dry season ideal for tomato cultivation
description: Tomatoes thrive in the cool months of January with less rainfall and moderate temperatures.
tips: Ensure good drainage and regular watering. Apply balanced fertilizer every 2 weeks.

plantingReason: Cool weather vegetable, grows best in dry season
description: January's cooler temperatures are perfect for crisp, healthy lettuce growth.
tips: Plant in well-drained soil with partial shade. Keep soil moist but not waterlogged.

plantingReason: Warm season crop, plant before intense summer heat
description: February provides ideal conditions before the peak summer temperatures arrive.
tips: Requires full sun and well-drained soil. Stake plants for support as they grow.

plantingReason: Heat-loving vine crop, best planted before rainy season
description: Ampalaya thrives in warm weather and should be established before heavy rains.
tips: Provide strong trellis support. Regular harvesting encourages more fruit production.

plantingReason: Short-duration crop ideal for dry season
description: Quick-growing legume perfect for planting before the wet season begins.
tips: Requires minimal water. Harvest when 80% of pods turn black for best quality.

plantingReason: Warm-season crop, plant before rainy season
description: Cucumbers need warm temperatures but should be established before heavy rainfall.
tips: Provide trellis for climbing. Pick fruits regularly to encourage continuous production.

plantingReason: Plant at start of rainy season for optimal growth
description: April marks the beginning of wet season, perfect timing for corn planting.
tips: Plant in blocks for better pollination. Side-dress with nitrogen fertilizer at knee-high stage.

plantingReason: Wet season rice planting, abundant rainfall available
description: May is ideal for wet season rice cultivation with consistent rainfall.
tips: Maintain 2-5cm water level in field. Control weeds early to prevent yield loss.

plantingReason: Rain-fed crop, thrives with regular moisture
description: Squash benefits from May's rainfall while still getting enough sunlight.
tips: Plant on mounds for better drainage. Hand pollinate if needed for better fruit set.

plantingReason: Wet season planting with good rainfall
description: Sitaw grows well with regular rainfall but needs good drainage.
tips: Provide sturdy poles or trellis. Pick pods young and tender for best quality.

plantingReason: Water-loving vegetable, perfect for wet season
description: Kangkong thrives in wet conditions and grows rapidly during rainy months.
tips: Can be grown in water or moist soil. Harvest by cutting, leaving 2-3 nodes for regrowth.

plantingReason: Root crop suited for wet season planting
description: Sweet potato establishes well during rainy season for harvest in cooler months.
tips: Plant on raised beds for better drainage. Harvest when leaves start yellowing.

plantingReason: Heat and moisture loving crop
description: Okra thrives in hot, humid conditions with regular rainfall.
tips: Harvest pods when 3-4 inches long. Pick daily to encourage continuous production.

plantingReason: Fast-growing leafy vegetable for transition period
description: Pechay grows well as rainfall begins to decrease toward end of wet season.
tips: Plant in succession every 2 weeks for continuous harvest. Protect from heavy rain.

plantingReason: Cool season crop, plant as weather cools
description: September's cooler temperatures signal good time for radish planting.
tips: Thin seedlings to 2-3 inches apart. Harvest when roots reach desired size.

plantingReason: Cool weather root crop, best in dry season start
description: October's cooler, drier conditions are ideal for sweet, crisp carrots.
tips: Requires loose, deep soil. Keep soil moist until germination, then water deeply.

plantingReason: Cool season crop, plant in dry season
description: Cabbage develops best heads in cool, dry conditions of October onwards.
tips: Plant in rich soil with good drainage. Side-dress with nitrogen when heads start forming.

plantingReason: Long-day variety suitable for dry season
description: November planting allows onions to mature during cool, dry months.
tips: Keep weed-free. Stop watering 2 weeks before harvest when tops fall over.

plantingReason: Requires cool dry season for bulb development
description: November's cool weather is perfect for garlic to establish and form bulbs.
tips: Plant individual cloves 2 inches deep. Harvest when leaves begin to dry and yellow.

plantingReason: Cool season crop, avoid extreme heat
description: December's mild temperatures provide excellent conditions for sweet peppers.
tips: Stake plants for support. Harvest green or wait for full color development.

plantingReason: Requires cool temperatures for flowering and fruiting
description: December's cool climate is ideal for establishing strawberry plants in highlands.
tips: Plant in raised beds with mulch. Remove runners to focus energy on fruit production.

plantingReason: Warm season crop, plant in dry season
description: January planting ensures fruit develops during warm, dry months for best sweetness.
tips: Requires lots of space. Check ripeness by tapping - ripe fruit sounds hollow.

plantingReason: Year-round crop, best planted at start of wet season
description: April planting allows papaya to establish with good rainfall support.
tips: Plant 2-3 seedlings per hole, thin to best plant. Protect from strong winds.

plantingReason: Year-round crop, wet season planting for good establishment
description: May's rainfall helps banana suckers establish strong root systems.
tips: Plant suckers from healthy mother plants. Remove extra suckers to maintain 1-2 per clump.
